result.execSummary:
The defendant Alecia A Yance was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of of $50.00 per month commencing 01/03/2017; alternate 13 days jail.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

DNA costs to be paid along with fine on payment plan.

It is the Defendant's burden to petition the Court to receive the benefit of expunction. Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alecia A Yance

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Alecia A Yance in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is being heard by this court for Judge Maxwell - Br. 8.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $479.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 1/3/17, alternate 13 days jail if not paid)  

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
